name: a

attributes.name: rel
attributes.description: Relationship between current document and linked document

notes: Use rel="noopener" with target="_blank" for security.

name: abbr
notes: Use the title attribute to provide the full expansion.

name: address
description: Represents contact information for the author/owner of a document.
notes: Typically used in the <footer> section of a document.

name: area
description: Defines an area inside an image map.

attributes.name: shape
attributes.description: Shape of the area (rect, circle, poly, default)

notes: Used within a <map> element to define clickable areas.

name: article
description: Represents a self-contained composition in a document.
notes: Use for blog posts, forum posts, news stories, comments, etc.

name: aside
description: Represents content indirectly related to the main content.
notes: Often used for sidebars, pull quotes, or advertisements.

name: audio
example:
<audio controls>
  <source src="audio.mp3" type="audio/mpeg">
  Your browser does not support the audio element.
</audio>
notes: Always provide fallback content for older browsers.

name: b
description: Represents text stylistically different from normal text, without conveying extra importance.
example: This text is normal, this text is bold.
notes: Use <strong> for text of greater importance, not just stylistic bolding.

name: base
description: Specifies the base URL to use for all relative URLs in a document.
notes: Must be placed in the <head> section. Only one <base> element is allowed.

name: bdi
description: Isolates a span of text that might be formatted in a different direction.
notes: Useful for user-generated content with unknown text direction.

name: bdo
notes: Use dir="ltr" for left-to-right or dir="rtl" for right-to-left.

name: blockquote
description: Represents a section that is quoted from another source.

attributes.name: cite
attributes.description: URL of the source of the quotation

notes: Use <cite> element to reference the source.

name: body
description: Represents the content of an HTML document.
notes: There can be only one <body> element in a document.

name: br
description: Produces a line break in text.
notes: Self-closing tag. Use sparingly and consider CSS for spacing.

name: button
notes: Buttons are better for accessibility than <div> or <span> elements.

name: canvas
description: Used to draw graphics via scripting (usually JavaScript).
notes: Requires JavaScript to draw graphics. Not accessible by default.

name: caption
description: Represents the title of a table.
notes: Must be the first child of its parent <table> element.

name: cite
description: Represents the title of a work (e.g. a book, article, poem, song, etc.).
example: The Scream by Edvard Munch. Painted in 1893.
notes: Typically displayed in italics by browsers.

name: code
description: Represents a fragment of computer code.
